item.title: Luchar por la feminidad, no por el feminismo
item.description: Nuevas generaciones de mujeres de derecha replantean su identidad política y cultural a partir de una crítica al feminismo dominante.
item.dc:creator: Emma Goldberg

item.title: Nine People Killed in Mass Shooting at Tavern in South Africa
item.description: Around a dozen gunmen opened fire at random at bar patrons. The police said they launched a manhunt to find the unknown assailants.
item.dc:creator: Jin Yu Young

media:content.media:description: The police in Johannesburg say they have begun a manhunt for the suspects.

item.title: My Oldest Old Friend
item.description: She was a great-grandmother, and I was a millennial. We could have talked forever.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Feintzeig

item.title: A Lifeline for New York’s Working Families
item.description: Children’s Aid provides free after-school programs for low-income New Yorkers that students love and parents see as a solution.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

media:content.media:credit: Ahmed Gaber for The New York Times

item.title: The Pompidou Center Has Been Emptied of Its Art. We Watched It Happen.
item.description: The Pompidou Center is the place to see contemporary art in Paris. Or it was, until curators put its astonishing collection into storage.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Porter and Dmitry Kostyukov

media:content.media:credit: Simon Hantaï/2025 Archives Simon Hantaï/Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York/ADAGP, Paris; Photo: Dmitry Kostyukov for The New York Times

item.title: Quote of the Day: Seeking Global Patients, Despite Organ Shortage
item.description: Quotation of the Day for December 21, 2025.

item.title: How China Tried to Dismantle a Major Underground Church
item.description: Videos and photographs show how the Chinese authorities have tried to dismantle Zion Church, a Christian network with branches across the country.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Wang

item.title: Long Before Bondi Massacre, Australian Jews Lived With a Sense of Peril
item.description: Armed guards, bollards and secretive precautions became part of life amid antisemitic attacks and blurred lines between anger at Israel and hatred of Jews.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Kim and Matthew Abbott
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Jewish men walking behind the hearse carrying the coffin of Rabbi Eli Schlanger as it departed the Chabad of Bondi in Sydney on Wednesday.

item.title: A Neighborhood in India Fears Being Blamed for a Distant Atrocity
item.description: The attacker killed at last week’s Hanukkah celebration in Australia came from a Muslim area whose residents have long gone abroad to seek better lives.
item.dc:creator: Pragati K.B.

media:content.media:credit: Saumya Khandelwal for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Toli Chowki, an area of the southern Indian city of Hyderabad with many Muslim residents, has been in an unwelcome spotlight in recent days.

item.title: No Corrections: Dec. 21, 2025
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Sunday, Dec. 21, 2025.

item.title: President Trump Wants to Be Everywhere, All the Time
item.description: President Trump dominates our collective consciousness. The Times broke down how he has relentlessly pursued attention in the first 329 days of his second term.
item.dc:creator: Michael M. Grynbaum and Stuart A. Thompson

item.title: Power Returns to Most of San Francisco After Widespread Outage
item.description: The hourslong outage affected nearly a third of the city and forced the closure of transit stations. Service was restored for many customers late Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Alessandro Marazzi Sassoon

media:content.media:description: A Waymo vehicle idling at an intersection with no operating traffic lights on Saturday.

item.title: Turning Point’s Annual Gathering Turns Into a Gripefest
item.description: At AmericaFest, conservative leaders insulted one another, revealing serious rifts over conspiracy theories, antisemitism and who belongs in America.
item.dc:creator: Richard Fausset and Ken Bensinger

media:content.media:credit: Jordan Gale for The New York Times

item.title: Epstein Files Photos Disappear From Government Website, Including One of Trump
item.description: A total of 16 photos were taken down at some point on Saturday from the website that the Justice Department created. One featured an open drawer containing other photos, including at least one of President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Alan Feuer, David Enrich and Dylan Freedman
item.category: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

item.title: First Batch of Epstein Files Provides Few Revelations
item.description: The Justice Department, under pressure from Congress to comply with a law signed by President Trump, released more than 13,000 files on Friday arising from investigations into Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: McKinnon de Kuyper

item.title: Present Time
item.description: David Kwong, the magician, branches out with a festive Sunday puzzle.
item.dc:creator: Caitlin Lovinger

media:content.media:description: Santa Claus working on his ski plane (after sabotage by reindeer, possibly) in a window display at Selfridges in London, in 2013.

item.title: Epstein and Maxwell Grand Jury Records Are Released
item.description: The transcripts and photos were part of Department of Justice files arising from investigations into the disgraced financier and his former girlfriend.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Weiser

media:content.media:description: An undated image of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell released by the Department of Justice on Friday.

item.title: Land Grab: Inside Israel’s Escalating Campaign for Control of the West Bank
item.description: Israeli seizure of Palestinian lands in the West Bank, often brutally, has accelerated, raising doubts about the prospects of a peaceful solution to the conflict.
item.dc:creator: Michael D. Shear, Daniel Berehulak, Leanne Abraham and Fatima AbdulKarim

item.title: Bill Clinton Photos in Epstein Files Show He Can’t Escape Scandal
item.description: The Republican-led Justice Department’s release of photos of the former president with Jeffrey Epstein will introduce yet another generation to his flaws and controversies.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Lerer

media:content.media:description: Former President Bill Clinton and Jeffrey Epstein in one of the photos released by the Justice Department on Friday. Information was not provided on when or where it was taken.

item.title: U.S. Coast Guard Boards Tanker Carrying Venezuelan Oil
item.description: Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, said a vessel had been “apprehended.” It was the second action this month against a tanker carrying Venezuelan oil.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Nehamas, Anatoly Kurmanaev and Christiaan Triebert

item.title: Cynthia Lummis, a One-Term G.O.P. Senator, Will Not Seek Re-election
item.description: A conservative who has served in the Senate since 2021, Ms. Lummis attributed the decision to the “difficult, exhausting session” this fall on Capitol Hill.
item.dc:creator: Catie Edmondson

media:content.media:credit: Haiyun Jiang for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: In a statement, Senator Cynthia Lummis of Wyoming said that “I’ve come to accept that I do not have six more years in me.”

item.title: 6 puntos clave del primer lote de los archivos Epstein
item.description: Muchos de los documentos están ampliamente censurados, y rara vez se menciona al presidente Trump. La Casa Blanca también intentó sacar provecho político de la publicación de fotos de Bill Clinton.
item.dc:creator: Alan Feuer

item.title: Overlooked No More: Inge Lehmann, Who Discovered the Earth’s Inner Core
item.description: She pointed to evidence that the Earth’s inner core was solid — not liquid, as scientists had believed — a discovery that was ahead of its time.
item.dc:creator: Dylan Loeb McClain

item.title: California Faces a Weeklong Lashing of Rain, Wind and Some Snow
item.description: Forecasters said a parade of storms from the Pacific Ocean will pull in a river of moisture. Over the next week, parts of Northern California could get seven to 10 inches of rain.
item.dc:creator: Amy Graff

item.title: EE. UU. y Venezuela bloquean el GPS en el Caribe, poniendo la aviación en peligro
item.description: La tensión militar entre Donald Trump y Nicolás Maduro ha provocado un aumento de la guerra electrónica en la región.
item.dc:creator: Riley Mellen and Anatoly Kurmanaev
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Alejandro Cegarra para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Un miembro de las fuerzas de seguridad de Venezuela en la pista del Aeropuerto Internacional de Maiquetía, en Caracas, este mes. La Administración Federal de Aviación ha emitido una advertencia a todos los aviones que operan allí.

item.title: Passenger Train in India Hits Elephant Herd, Killing Seven
item.description: No people were injured in the accident, despite a partial derailment. As elephant habitat shrinks, such deadly encounters are on the rise.
item.dc:creator: Pragati K.B.

media:content.media:description: Workers making repairs after a train hit a herd of elephants early Saturday in northeastern India.

item.title: Now Bring Us Some Sticky Toffee Pudding
item.description: No tricky techniques, no specialty ingredients, just perfect sticky toffee pudding with “extra” sauce.
item.dc:creator: Mia Leimkuhler

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Testani for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Monica Pierini.
media:content.media:description: Simon Hopkinson’s sticky toffee pudding, adapted by Mark Bittman.

item.title: Donald Trump Is Very Unhappy With You
item.description: It’s all over but the shouting.
item.dc:creator: Jamelle Bouie

media:content.media:credit: Jason Hendardy for The New York Times

item.title: Robert Mnuchin, Stock Trader Turned Art Dealer, Dies at 92
item.description: A major player in the block-trading boom, he left Wall Street for the art world, winning a Jeff Koons sculpture at auction for $91 million in 2019.
item.dc:creator: Matt Phillips

media:content.media:description: From left, Mr. Mnuchin, Gustave Levy and Howard Young in the trading room of Goldman Sachs in 1971.

item.title: Bowen Yang Is Leaving ‘S.N.L.’ After This Weekend’s Episode
item.description: Yang has been part of the NBC sketch show since 2018, earning five Emmy nominations.
item.dc:creator: Maya Salam

media:content.media:description: Bowen Yang’s memorable “Saturday Night Live” characters include the iceberg that sank the Titanic.

item.title: Estos pequeños gestos ayudan a navegar el duelo
item.description: Nuestros lectores compartieron prácticos actos de amabilidad que marcaron una diferencia.
item.dc:creator: Jancee Dunn

item.title: Make Sugar Cake Your New Holiday Tradition
item.description: Moravian sugar cake is a pillowy cake-bread hybrid with a caramelized crust and, best of all, little pockets of crunchy, buttery sugar.
item.dc:creator: Vaughn Vreeland

media:content.media:credit: Andrew Bui for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Kaitlin Wayne.

item.title: Colorado State Senator at Fault in Car Crash That Killed Her, Officials Say
item.description: A toxicology report found elevated levels of alcohol in Senator Faith Winter’s blood at the time of the November crash.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Wolfe

media:content.media:description: A memorial service for state Senator Faith Winter on the steps of the Colorado State Capitol in Denver this month.

item.title: From A.I. to Tariffs, 14 Charts That Explain 2025
item.description: President Trump’s trade policy, inflation and climbing stock prices shaped business and the economy this year.
item.dc:creator: Christine Zhang

item.title: U.S. Strikes on Syria Underscore Scale of Challenge for Its President
item.description: The Syrian government did not comment directly on the extensive U.S. strikes targeting the Islamic State on Friday but said it was intensifying its own efforts to fight the group.
item.dc:creator: Abdi Latif Dahir and Eric Schmitt
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

media:content.media:credit: Nanna Heitmann for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Syrian government forces at a checkpoint on the outskirts of Damascus in April. The U.S. launched airstrikes against the Islamic State in central Syria on Friday.

item.title: Closing Arguments
item.description: Today, your highly personal, delightfully specific bests of 2025.
item.dc:creator: Melissa Kirsch

item.title: Conservative Leaders Can’t Ignore Candace Owens
item.description: The right mastered influencer politics. Now they’re tearing the movement apart.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Goldberg

item.title: Marco Rubio Is Winning the Trump Era
item.description: The secretary of state has somehow avoided becoming either a media fixation or a major player in the right’s unfolding psychodrama.
item.dc:creator: Ross Douthat
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

item.title: Why I Gave Up Holiday Hosting
item.description: I spent years dreaming of giving up, but figuring out how, when the role of host had calcified around me like plaster, seemed impossible.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Austin

item.title: Trump’s Address Was a ‘Lame-Duck Speech’
item.description: Jamelle Bouie argues that the administration already looks burned out — with three more years to go.

item.title: Who Is Actually Running America?
item.description: On “The Opinions” podcast, Jamelle Bouie argues we’re observing a presidency run by people pursuing “their own narrow ideological political goals using the president’s authority.”

item.title: The White House Is Just ‘Trying to Keep Grandpa Busy’
item.description: Jamelle Bouie, Michelle Cottle and David French convene to discuss the year that was.
item.dc:creator: Jamelle Bouie, Michelle Cottle, David French and Vishakha Darbha
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
United States Agency for International Development

item.title: The A.I. Models Are Competing for Your Affection
item.description: Major A.I. companies are competing to give their models the most appealing personality.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Witt

item.title: What Would Surprise Jesus About Christmas 2025?
item.description: An eminent New Testament scholar recounts what he says was the message of Jesus that transformed the West.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Kristof

item.title: This Nonprofit Is Expanding Access to Tech Careers
item.description: Per Scholas has helped over 30,000 people, about half of whom never graduated from a four-year college, break into careers in tech.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

media:content.media:credit: Ahmed Gaber for The New York Times

item.title: When Judges Are Attacked, You Suffer
item.description: When a judge has to ask if one ruling is a “safer choice for their family” than another, is it still justice? New Jersey judge Esther Salas explains how political attacks have threatened the foundation of the U.S. judiciary.
item.dc:creator: Esther Salas

item.title: Was 2025 the End of ‘Teflon Trump’?
item.description: Jamelle Bouie, Michelle Cottle and David French convene to discuss the year that was.

item.title: Should I Feel Bad About Joining a Concierge Medical Practice?
item.description: I can afford the membership fee, but I’m torn about the ethics of being part of this growing trend.
item.dc:creator: Kwame Anthony Appiah

item.title: NYT Connections Answers for Dec. 21, 2025
item.description: Scroll down for hints and conversation about the puzzle for Sunday, Dec. 21, 2025.
item.dc:creator: New York Times Games

item.title: Best of 2025, Canada Edition
item.description: Here are the Canadian standouts from The Times’s culture, books and arts coverage over the last year.
item.dc:creator: Vjosa Isai

media:content.media:description: Margaret Atwood’s memoir is one of The Times’s Notable Books of 2025.
